intro: Chenopodium baccatum subsp. baccatum, commonly known as goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its rough, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is typically found in disturbed soils and arid environments. It is an annual herb that can grow up to 1 meter in height. The species is known for its nutritional value and has been used in traditional medicine and as a food source in various cultures.
